name: Fulcrum
description:
Fulcrum invests in businesses developing commercially scalable technologies that serve both open markets and national interests. In a world where security, resilience, and infrastructure integrity define economic strength, we invest in the systems that safeguard institutions and underpin strategic advantage.

Deal Stages: Post-seed growth, Mature tech spin-outs International scale-ups

Sectors: Unmanned Aerial and Maritime Systems & Vehicles Data Infrastructure Cyber and AI Simulation Robotics. We are a defence-tech platform focused on European ventures.

Region: Europe, Canada
investmentAreas: Unmanned Aerial and Maritime Systems & Vehicles; Data Infrastructure; Cyber and AI; Simulation; Robotics; VR/AR

name: Prospera Ventures Ltd
description: Prospera is an angel syndicate supporting early-stage startups across Ireland and Europe. We bring together experienced and emerging business angels to invest in high-potential, founder-led ventures, with a focus on inclusivity, innovation, and long-term impact. Our platform makes angel investing more accessible through a streamlined, regulated syndicate model, enabling syndicate members to co-invest with confidence and efficiency. Beyond capital, we provide founders with strategic support, network access, and operational know-how to help them grow and succeed. We are sector-agnostic and welcome opportunities to back ambitious founders from all industries and backgrounds. At Prospera, we believe in supporting exceptional entrepreneurs at the earliest stages empowering them to build the future.
investmentAreas: Early-Stage Startups,Tech-Enabled Innovation,Impact-Driven Businesses, European Founders

name: Fountain Healthcare Partners
description: Fountain Healthcare Partners is a life science venture capital firm based in Dublin Ireland with an office in New York. Fountain currently manages over €300M and is actively investing its third fund raised in 2019. The team at Fountain originally worked within the corporate VC group at Elan Corporation and raised its first independent fund in 2008. Fountain invests in drugs, devices and diagnostics with a focus on companies developing innovative products that address unmet medical needs and deliver significant pharmacoeconomic benefits.
investmentAreas: Specialty Pharma, Biopharmaceuticals, Medical Devices, Diagnostics

name: AIB Start-up Accelerator
description: Act VC is an early-stage venture capital firm that partners with founders starting out, and established teams scaling their growth. We have raised over €600m across multiple funds to support this goal. We look for innovative, category-defining companies in large markets. We help founders build and scale these leveraging the experience of backing over 200 founders before. We work closely with them in this process. Over the past 25 years, we have invested in over 120 companies and built a broad global network.
investmentAreas: Smart Energy, AI, Digital Health, Wellness

name: Elkstone
description: Elkstone is a leading Irish investment firm that specialises in alternatives. Elkstone Venture, supported by the Irish Strategic Investment Fund and Enterprise Ireland, has established itself as the Irish venture ecosystem champion and is recognised as the leading early-stage venture investor in Ireland.
investmentAreas: Sector Agnostic

name: Allegion Ventures
description: Allegion Ventures is the corporate venture fund of Allegion. It invests in and accelerates the growth of companies with innovative, technologies, and products that have the potential to make security and access smarter, stronger, faster, and less intrusive. Allegion Ventures was established in 2003 and is headquartered in Dublin, Ireland.
investmentAreas: Venture Capital, Investment, Innovative, Technologies, Products

name: The Yield Lab Europe
description: The Yield Lab was established in 2014 to address the shortage of capital and support for early-stage agriculture technology companies. Recognizing that agricultural innovation is crucial for sustainably feeding a growing global population, the firm aims to enable entrepreneurs to revolutionize agrifood systems worldwide. The Yield Lab operates through four funds across Europe, Latin America, Asia Pacific, and North America. Each regional fund invests in agrifoodtech companies ranging from seed stage to growth stage, providing not only capital but also international business connections and access to the entire Yield Lab international network. Since its founding, the firm has built a portfolio of approximately 90 companies and established a presence in four international locations. The Yield Lab continues to expand and evolve to meet the increasing demand for agricultural innovation, with the ultimate goal of sustainably feeding the world.
investmentAreas: AgTech, Biotech, Machine Learning, Foodtech, Novel Farming Systems

name: Selenean Capital
description: Selenean Capital has successfully built a diverse portfolio of companies across aviation, defence, cybersecurity, transportation, medical technology, and renewables. The firm currently manages €175 million and is experiencing growth. Their strong performance is based on a comprehensive investment strategy tailored to the specific needs of both their portfolio companies and investors. They believe that future success requires continued innovation and diversification to ensure long-term sustainable growth. Their investments are underpinned by thorough technical assessments, driven by a team of domain experts with proven track records in their respective fields. This approach allows Selenean Capital to make informed investment decisions and provide valuable support to their portfolio companies across various sectors.
investmentAreas: AI, Blockchain, IoT, Web3

name: WakeUp Capital
description: WakeUp Capital is an early-stage impact venture fund that invests in companies with strong business models and potential for positive societal and environmental change. The firm provides funding and expertise to help visionary entrepreneurs scale their impact and measure their success. WakeUp Capital's approach balances financial returns with social and environmental impact targets, reflecting their commitment to building a cleaner, healthier, and fairer future. By supporting founders in translating their visions into tangible, measurable outcomes, WakeUp Capital aims to accelerate systemic change that benefits both people and the planet.
investmentAreas: AgTech, Novel Farming Systems, Circular Economy, FoodTech, Smart Energy, Smart Energy Sustainable Solutions

name: Seroba Life Sciences
description: Seroba is a leading European life sciences venture capital firm, dedicated to creating value by supporting innovative biotech and medtech companies. With a focus on breakthrough technologies, Seroba has backed significant advancements such as Shorla Oncology's FDA-approved TEPYLUTE, a ready-to-dilute formulation for treating breast and ovarian cancer. Based in Dublin, Seroba leverages deep industry expertise to help entrepreneurs build world-class businesses, fostering extraordinary scientific innovations.
investmentAreas: Biotechnology, Therapeutics, Medtech, Health care, science, oncology

name: Social Innovation Fund Ireland
description: Rethink Ireland is dedicated to backing big ideas and sustainable solutions to create an inclusive and equitable Ireland, providing cash grants and business support to social innovations with impactful potential. Partnering with individuals, families, and businesses, they identify and support charities and social enterprises making significant progress across areas like education, health, social enterprise, equality, and climate justice. With a presence in Galway, Cork, and Dublin, Rethink Ireland nurtures communities of like-minded organizations, facilitating access to networks and resources to scale their impact nationwide.
investmentAreas: Charity, Sports, Education, Health, Equality, social enterprise, greentech

name: Two Culture Capital
description: Founded in 2016, Two Culture Capital is a venture capital investment firm based in Dublin, Ireland. The firm prefers to invest in technology and artificial intelligence startup companies.
investmentAreas: Fintech, software, AI, Insurtech

name: Atlantic Bridge University Fund
description: Atlantic Bridge is a venture capital firm investing in entrepreneurs aiming to build world-class companies, particularly those emerging from leading universities. Focused on sectors like AI, robotics, quantum computing, and healthtech, Atlantic Bridge leverages a proven global value creation model to scale innovative technologies addressing global concerns. With substantial backing from the University Bridge Fund and other investment partners, Atlantic Bridge offers capital, scaling expertise, and international market access to drive sustainable growth and commercial success for its portfolio companies.
investmentAreas: AI, robotics, quantum computing, and healthtech

name: APRIL Ventures
description: Striving to nurture entrepreneurs, April Ventures typically invests early in a company's life, seeking outstanding individuals and companies with the potential to become industry leaders. Emphasizing large market sizes, the firm aims to build big companies, whether disruptive in existing markets or innovative in new ones. Engaging with startups as trusted advisors, they provide additional resources to founding teams. Focus sectors include technology-leveraged startups, Web3, and blockchain projects, with a particular interest in fintech, Web3, and infrastructure innovation.
investmentAreas: Gaming, Retail, Healthcare, Web3, Fintech

name: MASV.com
description: MASV invests in innovative, high-growth startups and seeks driven entrepreneurs to join their growing portfolio. They combine investment and financial acumen with marketing and communications support. They are an entrepreneur-led investment company on a mission to enable founders to reach a global scale with a collaborative investment model.
investmentAreas: Impact Investing, FemTech, FashionTech, Ecommerce, Healthtech, Wellness, AI, Travel Tech

name: Venturewave Capital
description: VentureWave Capital invests in tech-for-good companies, focusing on those that produce socially impactful products and address the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). They work closely with talented entrepreneurs to build lasting value and maximize benefits for all stakeholders, following Impact Investing principles. Their strategy emphasizes investing in people, supporting entrepreneurs with proven methods to scale and grow their businesses. VentureWave Capital believes that enterprise and innovation can create more equitable and sustainable societies, considering Impact Investing as the right way to do business.
investmentAreas: Impact Investing, Healthtech, Food and Beverage, EdTech

name: CircleRock Capital
description: CircleRock Capital is a top European co-investor in technology companies and consumer brands, focusing on Seed, Series A, and Series B funding stages. They invest alongside leading global VC firms, without leading deals or taking board seats, with typical investments ranging from €500,000 to €2 million. Their limited partners include experienced professionals like exited entrepreneurs, tech leaders, and prominent angels. Known for their fundraising expertise and valuable network, CircleRock’s founders have strong track records, with offices in Dublin and London highlighting their European focus.
investmentAreas: AI, ML, Fintech, Healtech, SaaS

name: Deeptech Seed Fund
description: Deeptech.eu is a venture capital firm focused on European deeptech startups showing early signs of global market potential. They invest in companies across various sectors, excluding life sciences, that have initial customer traction. The firm's unique approach involves validating opportunities through customer feedback and consulting with international later-stage investors to ensure promising ventures receive appropriate funding from the start. This strategy helps Deeptech.eu make informed investment decisions and addresses the challenge many deeptech startups face in finding investors who understand their complex propositions.
investmentAreas: Deep Tech, AI, Robotics, Hardware

name: Earth First Food Ventures
description: Earth First Food Ventures was established by visionary leaders with extensive experience in international financial markets. The firm initially entered the innovative food technologies sector in 2017 and has since focused on the growing and exciting smart protein space, including plant-based, fermentation, and cultivated assets. Over time, Earth First Food Ventures has developed a rich network of industry partners with global reach, capital, and a proven track record. The firm facilitates early and transformational investments in companies led by visionary founders and proven execution teams, targeting ventures with significant potential for impact. Earth First Food Ventures' approach combines their financial expertise with a deep understanding of the alternative protein industry to identify and support promising opportunities in this rapidly evolving sector.
investmentAreas: Plant-based, Fermentation Tech, Cultivated Assets, Food Tech

name: Hatch Blue Ltd
description: HATCH Fund I, launched in 2018, has a global focus on aquaculture and alternative seafood technologies. This fund has invested €1.76 million to date and currently holds a net asset value of €6.8 million. HATCH's investment scope encompasses a wide range of innovative technologies and solutions within the aquaculture and alternative seafood sectors, with a geographic reach that extends worldwide.
investmentAreas: AgTech, Aquaculture, Clean Tech, Water Tech, Sustainable Farming, Alternative Proteins, Seafood

name: Enterprise Equity
description: Enterprise Equity is a venture capital firm with over 25 years of experience investing in internationally focused Irish companies. They provide funding for early-stage, high-growth technology businesses, offering more than just capital by delivering sound corporate governance and strategic advice. As the Investment General Partner of the AIB Seed Capital Fund with a committed fund size of €53 million, they support start-ups and early-stage companies in Ireland with significant growth potential.
investmentAreas: Health care, medtech, software, biotech

name: Furthr VC
description: Furthr VC is a relationship-driven early-stage venture capital firm investing in ambitious founders building the future. They focus on Seed to Series A investments in globally oriented Irish software and medtech companies, offering hands-on support and strategic guidance to accelerate growth. With over 50 early-stage companies backed across 100+ investment rounds, Furthr VC reserves significant capital for follow-on investments to support founders throughout their journey.
investmentAreas: Medical Device, Software, Health care

name: Growing Capital
description: Growing Capital is an early-stage investment firm established in 2015 and headquartered in Dublin, focusing on supporting Irish startups. They have backed over 25 startups, including notable successes like Glofox, Caragon, Flipdish, and ScalaPay. Growing Capital targets early-stage Irish software startups with a B2B business model, offering initial investments from €50K to €100K and prioritizing companies emerging from pre-accelerator programs. They seek founders who are problem solvers with the potential to lead and grow their businesses to at least €2 million ARR within three years.
investmentAreas: Healthcare, neuroscience, medtech, SaaS

name: Irelandia Aviation
description: Irelandia Aviation is the pioneer of the low-cost carrier (LCC) model in Europe, replicating this successful model globally. Notable ventures include Viva Aerobus, Allegiant Air, Viva Air, Tigerair, Ryanair, and Viva Colombia. Headquartered in Dublin, Irelandia Aviation continues to lead and innovate in the LCC industry.
investmentAreas: Travel, aerospace, drones, mobility, transportation

name: Irrus Investments
description: Irrus Investments is a member-led organization providing mentorship and funding to early-stage companies, primarily in Ireland. They have invested over €40 million, offering seed funding from €500k to €1 million and facilitating larger investments through syndication with other venture capital firms. Irrus Investments is comprised of over 40 experienced entrepreneurs and professionals from diverse industries, committed to supporting innovative small businesses and startups.
investmentAreas: Healcare, Medtech, medical care, biotech

name: Irish Venture Capital Association
description: The Irish Venture Capital Association (IVCA) represents venture capital and private equity firms in Ireland, providing equity funding to high-growth, unquoted companies across diverse sectors. These long-term investments, typically lasting four to seven years, involve close collaboration with management teams to support growth and enhance business value. A thriving venture capital industry is vital for economic success, driving innovation, competitiveness, job creation, and overall economic growth.
investmentAreas: Sector agnostic

name: Kernel Capital
description: Kernel Capital is a Central Bank of Ireland regulated and UK Financial Conduct Authority authorised venture capital firm based in Ireland, focusing on investments in IP-rich companies across sectors like silicon chip design and data management. Since its establishment in 1999, Kernel Capital has raised €270M and led over 80 portfolio companies, completing significant transactions globally and raising €1.5BN+ for Irish technology companies. Their hands-on approach, combined with a deep global network, has delivered superior returns exceeding 20% Gross IRR, and in 2023, they launched Kernel Strategic, a boutique M&A business aimed at maximizing the value of deep IP companies.
investmentAreas: Health care, Medical, Biotech, Manufacturing, Mobile

name: LEAF Investments
description: Leaf Investments is an early-stage investor in learning technology businesses, aiming to support entrepreneurs both domestically and internationally by leveraging emerging technologies to create innovative learning solutions. Backed by Folens Publishers, Leaf combines deep industry expertise with investment experience, offering a comprehensive understanding of the challenges in scaling learning sector businesses. Their portfolio includes companies like ETU, Surewash, and Realizeit, with a team and advisory board experienced in fundraising, technology, and e-learning.
investmentAreas: Education, Sofware, E-learning, Edtech

name: Malin Corporation
description: Malin invests in and supports highly innovative life sciences companies developing cutting-edge science and technology to deliver transformative outcomes for patients and create significant value for shareholders. Headquartered in Ireland and listed on the Euronext Growth Market of Euronext Dublin, Malin aims to generate substantial returns for shareholders through long-term capital and strategic support to its investee companies. Focused on therapeutic areas like oncology, immunology, and genetic diseases, Malin prioritizes business integrity, collaboration with talented individuals, and the development of groundbreaking therapies where current treatments are inadequate.
investmentAreas: oncology, immunology, genetic diseases, medtech, health

name: OLMA Luxury Holdings
description: Founded in 2012, OLMA Luxury Holdings has invested over €150M in more than 14 companies across Europe and the US, focusing on experiential luxury and innovative luxury products and services. OLMA's agile and efficient platform identifies, finances, and supports the growth of start-ups and SMEs in Western Europe, reflecting new trends and consumption patterns. One notable investment is Caviar House & Prunier, where OLMA collaborates to enhance the brand's leadership in fine foods and promote the art of French caviar as a symbol of experiential luxury.
investmentAreas: luxury, food, jewellery, shopping, experiential marketing

name: Delta Partners
description: Delta Partners is a venture capital firm established in 1994, managing €230 million and investing primarily in early-stage technology companies in Ireland and the United Kingdom. With a strong focus on Information Technology, Communications, and Healthcare, the firm has made over 140 investments and achieved €1.8 billion in exit returns. Delta Partners is partner-led, offering deep operational, strategic, and financial expertise to support founders from seed to Series A, emphasizing the importance of building solid company foundations for sustainable growth.
investmentAreas: Fintech, software, healthtech, analytics, AI

name: Development Capital
description: Development Capital, founded in 2013, provides €2-12 million in growth capital to Irish SMEs, focusing on export markets. With €100 million invested in 12 companies, they offer flexible investment structures and take minority stakes to support growth strategies like expansion, acquisitions, and management buyouts. They prioritize responsible investing by integrating ESG considerations into their process.
investmentAreas: telecomunication, manufacturing, Healthcare, Cloud computing, pharmaceutical

name: eDot Invest
description: eDot is a technology-focused VC firm with a 10-year investment vehicle targeting early-stage tech companies with global growth potential. Founded by industry veterans like Alan Devlin and Kieran Sweeney, eDot combines investment with hands-on support to accelerate company growth and achieve quicker exits. Located in Dublin’s Silicon Docks, eDot also operates an internationally connected incubator, eDot Connect, fostering innovation and collaboration in the heart of Ireland's tech hub.
investmentAreas: vehicle, EV, mobility

name: BES Management
description: BES Management DAC, a joint venture of Davy and BDO, is Ireland's longest-running and most experienced BES/EIIS Fund Manager, having successfully raised and invested over €200 million in SMEs across the Republic of Ireland over the past 25 years. Their sector-agnostic approach allows them to support ambitious management teams in all 26 counties, leveraging their market knowledge to accelerate growth. Regulated by the Central Bank of Ireland, BES Management offers investors income tax relief, diversification, and regular communication, making it a reliable choice for EIIS fund investment opportunities.
investmentAreas: Sector agnostic

name: Chirisa
description: Chirisa is a private investment firm that identifies and develops distinctive opportunities for its investors and companies. The firm seeks situations where its capital, strategies, expertise, and operational support help create substantial and sustainable value. Leveraging insights from a broad network of industry professionals, Chirisa's multidisciplinary approach combines deep operational expertise with extensive private investment and financing experience, driving its exceptional track record.
investmentAreas: infrastructure,communications, real estate

name: COSIMO Ventures
description: COSIMO Ventures is a private investment firm that identifies and develops distinctive opportunities for its investors and companies. The firm seeks situations where its capital, strategies, expertise, and operational support help create substantial and sustainable value. Leveraging decades of experience, COSIMO Ventures offers extensive exposure across the digital asset ecosystem, including a hedge fund, a tokenized venture fund, and advisory services, supported by strategic investments in digital asset custody and brokerage providers.
investmentAreas: blockchain,data,fintech, service industry

name: Ronoc
description: Ronoc is a private advisory and investment firm specializing in emerging markets with a focus on fintech, digital payments, crypto exchange platforms, mobile financial services, and retail banking. The firm seeks to deliver positive returns that make a sustainable impact by leveraging its extensive experience and networks in emerging markets. With a team possessing over 100 years of operational and investment experience, Ronoc excels in retail financial services, fintech, and payments, driving growth and innovation in these sectors.
investmentAreas: Fintech, Payments, Banking

name: Tribal.vc
description: Tribal is a venture firm that empowers entrepreneurs on their unique path to success. They invest early and with conviction, using their experience and networks to guide founders and their teams as needed. With a structured evergreen investment entity, Tribal can be flexible, long-term partners, investing up to €2.5M at seed or series A stages. Their investment portfolio includes successful ventures such as Boxever, PaySlip, BrightFlag, Grid Beyond, and Glofox, among others.
investmentAreas: software, Saas, AI, Marketing automations,

name: Atlantic Bridge
description: Atlantic Bridge is a global growth equity technology firm that specializes in cross-border value-add and expansion capital for technology companies. With over €1 billion in assets under management across eight funds, the firm invests in deep technology companies in Europe, the UK, and the US, helping them expand internationally through a global platform with offices in Dublin, London, Munich, Paris, and Palo Alto.
investmentAreas: Deeptech, Cyber Security, Cloud Modern Data Stack, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Health Tech, Digital Health, Climate, Industry 4.0, Internet of Things, Advanced Manufacturing,

name: Act Venture Capital
description: Act Venture Capital is a generalist early-stage investment firm that supports the best startups to scale into large, category-defining companies. With a focus on building long-term relationships and backing serial founders, Act invests from seed to growth across different tech sectors, maintaining discipline and expertise in its areas of interest. The firm emphasizes the importance of great founders, ESG principles, and diverse teams, recognizing that these factors contribute to creating long-term sustainable value and market-leading returns for their investors.
investmentAreas: Health care, software, AI, sustainability

name: Business Venture Partners
description: BVP is a venture firm celebrating 20 years in business, having evolved from a boutique corporate finance advisory into a multi-asset investment platform. Specializing in early and growth stage investments, BVP focuses on health, climate, mobility, and technology, backing ambitious entrepreneurs and tailoring solutions to the unique needs of their companies. Guided by principles of transparency, sustainability, and resilience, BVP leverages its deep market insight and two decades of experience to provide flexible investment strategies, including both debt and equity, to support the growth of impactful businesses.
investmentAreas: Climate, health, Mobility, emerging technology

name: StartLab Galway
description: StartLab powered by Bank of Ireland, is a tech startup incubator program based in Galway, Ireland. A leading Irish bank, we offer a wide range of financial products including savings, loans, mortgages and deposit accounts. We're here to keep you up to date on our latest news and to provide useful information and guidance to support your financial needs.
investmentAreas: Retail Banking, Business Banking, Corporate Banking, Mortgages

name: SportsTech Ireland
description: Offering bespoke and tailored programs for SportsTech companies at all stages of development. SportsTech Ireland is the leading not-for-profit organisation powering the sports technology cluster in Ireland. The catalyst for creativity, community and collaboration in Ireland’s SportsTech sector.
investmentAreas: Sports, Sports Technology, Research, Innovation, Startups

name: Small Foundation
description: Small Foundation provides finance, technical assistance and skilled human resources. Small Foundation is a philanthropic foundation based in Ireland that is working to catalyse and scale income-generating opportunities for people living in extreme poverty in rural sub-Saharan Africa. Small Foundation's goal is to collaborate with those creating the environment for micro, small and medium enterprises to succeed and deliver opportunity at scale.
investmentAreas: International Trade, Development, Finance, Learning

name: New Frontiers
description: New Frontiers is Ireland's national entrepreneur development programme. You have the right idea or the right business that you want to get off the ground. The right time to join Enterprise Ireland’s New Frontiers programme and embark on a transformative startup journey that will equip you with the right connections, the right skills, and the right route to capital to build a successful and sustainable startup business.
investmentAreas: Business development, Entrepreneur development, Startups, Founders, Networking

name: NDRC
description: NDRC is a business that transforms entrepreneurial teams and ideas into startups with early investment and research help. The NDRC is Ireland’s national startup accelerator programme for globally ambitious entrepreneurs, powered by Dogpatch Labs in partnership with Portershed, RDI Hub, and Republic of Work. We help startups to succeed at every stage of their journey through coaching and mentoring, with a founder-first approach delivered by international experts.
investmentAreas: Finance, Financial Services, Venture Capital, Lending, Investments

name: NDRC LaunchPad
description: NDRC LaunchPad 10 is a business accelerator that enables entrepreneurial teams to transform solid ideas into commercially viable startups. The NDRC is Ireland’s national startup accelerator programme for globally ambitious entrepreneurs, powered by Dogpatch Labs in partnership with Portershed, RDI Hub, and Republic of Work. We help startups to succeed at every stage of their journey through coaching and mentoring, with a founder-first approach delivered by international experts.
investmentAreas: Collaborative Innovation, Early stage investment, Digital ventures, Pre-accelerator, Entrepreneurship

name: The Pearse Lyons Accelerator
description: The Pearse Lyons Accelerator is a three-month programme for 10 startups in agritech and ag-science. Drawing on our unique expertise and presence in more than 120 countries, the Pearse Lyons Cultivator creates pathways for the implementation of innovative solutions that support a Planet of Plenty. Our expanded year-round program enables ag-tech startups to establish commercial pilots with Alltech or one of their partner companies.
investmentAreas: Accelerator, AgTech, Agriculture, Startups, Business Development

name: Terenure Enterprise
description: Terenure Enterprise Centre is a voluntary organisation strongly committed to supporting economic development. Workspace for you to develop and grow your business. Located in the heart of Terenure Village, Dublin. Flexible coworking, hot desks, private offices and meeting spaces, Digital & Social Programme for people 55+.
investmentAreas: Business Incubation Space, Support, Community, Enterprise Centre, Dedicated Desks

name: Team ABC
description: Team ABC is an Ireland-based venture firm. Team ABC is an international investment and acceleration platform for companies innovating in air, land and sea travel. Team ABC finds, supports and scales early-stage disruptive technology startups focused on increasing sustainability and digital transformation in travel and logistics.
investmentAreas: Venture Capital, Private Equity Principals, Investment, Innovation

name: Dogpatch Labs
description: Dogpatch Labs provides platform for membership, community, and events. Dogpatch Labs is a startup and innovation hub located in the historic chq Building and in the heart of Dublin’s Digital Docklands. We foster entrepreneurship for startups, facilitate technology innovation for companies of all sizes and nurture transformative social enterprises. Accelerating Ireland's Startup Ecosystem.
investmentAreas: Accelerators, Coworking, Incubator, Programmes, Corporate Innovation

name: Continuous Ventures
description: Supporting start-ups navigate the journey to become a fund ready with our team of advisors with our expertise & developmental framework. We are a private Venture Studio and Strategy Bureau specializing in digital and Al transformation. We deliver intelligent, disruptive solutions for next-gen businesses and organizations, including public and private sector entities, specialist tech startups, and global corporates embracing innovation.
investmentAreas: Strategy, Tech Startups, Planning, Consulting, Board Management

name: Guinness Enterprise Centre
description: The Guinness Enterprise Centre (GEC) provides a dynamic environment to build and scale an international business. The GEC community shares knowledge, experience, ideas and contacts and create partnerships. We hold regular networking events, business seminars, hackathons and startup events. Business and technology leaders of today and tomorrow, business associations, MBA groups, government agencies and trade missions.
investmentAreas: Office space, Customer Service, Entrepreneurship, Networking, Business Advice

name: Hartnett Enterprise Acceleration Centre
description: Hartnett Enterprise Acceleration Centre is a business acceleration centre. The Hartnett Enterprise Acceleration Centre is part of a broader plan and greater vision to develop Innovation & Enterprise across Ireland and beyond. Through our Hartnett Enterprise Acceleration Centre alone, ’we have helped create over 90 companies between 2006 to present.
investmentAreas: Research, Development, Training, Entreprenuers

name: Accelerate Green
description: Accelerate Green, scales businesses that are at the forefront of sustainability and climate action by creating goods and services. An Executive Accelerator designed to scale your sustainability driven business. The mentors of the Accelerate Green programme are a key part of the the programme. They bring a wealth of industry experience both in Ireland and on the international stage.
investmentAreas: Sustainability, Cleantech, Climate Tech, Investing

name: Accenture Accelerator
description: Accenture Accelerator is an accelerator program. Accenture is a leading global professional services company that helps the world’s leading businesses, governments and other organizations build their digital core, optimize their operations, accelerate revenue growth and enhance citizen services—creating tangible value at speed and scale. We are a talent and innovation-led company serving clients in more than 120 countries. We combine our strength in technology and leadership in cloud, data and AI with unmatched industry experience, functional expertise and global delivery capability.
investmentAreas: Management Consulting, Systems Integration, Technology, Infrastructure Outsourcing

name: AgTechUCD
description: AgTechUCD is a accelerator programme for early-stage startups in Ireland and Europe, in the AgTech, FoodTech and VetTech sectors. University College Dublin is one of Europe's leading research-intensive universities; an environment where undergraduate education, masters and PhD training, research, innovation and community engagement form a dynamic spectrum of activity. With over 33,000 students drawn from 144 countries, including almost 4,000 students based on overseas campuses, UCD is not only Ireland's largest university but also its most globally engaged.
investmentAreas: Higher Education, Research, Innovation, Impact, Recruitment

name: AIB Equity
description: AIB Equity is the venture capital firm specializing in investments in early stage, late stage, growth capital and bridge loans. We're here to keep you updated on AIB Group news, financial services industry insights, expert business reports and all the latest AIB career opportunities. We are one of Ireland’s major retail banks serving personal, business and corporate customers. We offer a range of banking products and services such as mortgages, savings and business banking.
investmentAreas: Retail Banking, Business Banking, Mortgages, Insurance

name: Alpha Programme Dublin
description: Alpha Programme Dublin is a 12-week long intensive accelerator programme based in London & Dublin for startups at pre-seed stage. Huckletree is a network of curated workspaces in the UK & Ireland bringing together 4,000+ of the brightest minds working across dynamic tech and creative sectors including web3, fintech, AI, govtech and sustainable innovation. We create workspaces that help the world's most innovative companies thrive.
investmentAreas: Coworking, Workspace, Entrepreneurs, Hospitality, Sustainable Innovation

name: Alsessor
description: Alsessor is an AI Accelerator Program aims to support early-stage start-ups and entrepreneurs in the growth and commercializes business. AI Awards aim to showcase the work of companies and individuals who are applying AI in both commercial and academic contexts. Connecting Ireland’s AI ecosystem for a higher purpose.
investmentAreas: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, Deep Learning

name: Amena Ventures
description: Accelerator for new ventures focusing on products in the robotics and IoT sectors. Investment opportunities in Robotics and IoT companies. The potential of new ventures in the robotics and IoT space is disrupting how we live our lives for the better, and we want to be part of that. We are passionate about finding the resources to make businesses grow and prosper. Knowing and engaging with a founder's team to find the best investors determines the future of each venture.
investmentAreas: Seed Funding, Business Development, Governance, Risk Management, Operations Support
